instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: SSD doesn't work anymore (after I tried upgrading it)
threads.message:
The machine is a MacBook Pro 13" late 2012 (Model: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, Order: MD212). I tried upgrading the original 128GB SSD with a 500GB Samsung 860 EVO connected with an mSATA adapter (NewFrog product ID [URL="https://www.newfrog.com/product/high-quality-msata-ssd-adapter-for-apple-retina-79094"]79094[/URL]). Issue:

[I]The MacBook did not boot from the new Samsung SSD. After swapping back in the original SSD it doesn’t boot either.[/I]

Fortunately:

[I]The machine can still be booted via USB from the Samsung SSD in a USB-SSD adapter: Prior to the upgrade, I copied the entire system over using Carbon Copy Cloner.[/I]

Details:
[LIST]
[*]I created a Time Machine backup. So in case both SSDs fail, at least no data is lost.
[*]I precisely followed instructions from a YouTube video: [URL="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jYbwdcLr0gg"]How to Upgrade the SSD in a 13-inch MacBook Pro w/ Retina display (Late 2012–Early 2013) UPDATED[/URL]
[*]During the process I opened and closed the machine several times.
[*]Every time, before touching the SSD assembly, I made sure that the battery is disconnected. In fact I put a piece of paper in between the battery connector and its receptacle.
[*]I carefully unplugged the fragile SSD connector using one of my finger nails.
[*]I avoided bending the cables, being fully aware that they’re fragile.
[*]The first time that I put the Samsung SSD into the adapter, I didn’t push it all the way in. (to my excuse: the adapter is simply too short)
[*]I always made sure that I was grounded.
[*]I’m in Berlin, Germany.
[*]If further diagnosis is needed: I do own a multimeter as well as a Hantek 6022BE USB scope.
[*]It’s the MacBook of my girlfriend. I’m a ThinkPad user since 2000 (only briefly owned the first Unibody MacBook Pro 15", bought in late 2008).
[/LIST]

My thoughts:
[LIST]
[*]I read that the SSD cables in MacBooks are notoriously fragile. Possibly, the first thing to try is replacing the SSD cable (AFAIK 821-1506-B).
[*]In the worst case, when the Samsung SSD was not pushed into the adapter, a short was caused. Here I wouldn’t know what to do or how to diagnose the issue.
[/LIST]

[I]Any suggestions?[/I]

threads.title: SSD doesn't work anymore (after I tried upgrading it)
threads.message:
No Title

Photos of the first three times that I opened the machine. Afterwards, I put back in the original SSD, which – as mentioned – doesn’t work anymore as well. In fact, it is not detected after booting via USB.

threads.title: SSD doesn't work anymore (after I tried upgrading it)
threads.message:
You will need schematic and boardview of <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MLB.
Then need to measure around J4500 (SATA connector):

Look for power rails first, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_HDD_FLT</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: SSD doesn't work anymore (after I tried upgrading it)
threads.message: Thanks for your suggestions! I ordered a replacement cable now. Hope this does the trick.
